content.rendered:
I find that I never really get everything that I want. Getting what I want is an endless persist. Now, I have everything that I need: family, a few friends, food and shelter to name a few. But there’s always some camera equipment or the latest computer that I’d like to have.

Statistics show that more money only makes a person happier to a certain point and once that financial plato is reached, it doesn’t add any more happiness.

As a believer in Christ, I find my joy in Him. There is also, as the Bible says, a peace that passes understanding. The weight of the world can weight heavy, but Jesus promised that He has overcome the world.

There are certainly things that I don’t want: minor irritations. Yet, I realize that there are others who have things much worse than I do.

I find that the best thing is to just be content with what I have. In the end, the Bible tells me that even the things that seem to bother me, God can use them to produce in me the patients that lead to endurance. No, I never will have all of the things that I want. That list is just too long. But I can choose joy. I can be thankful for what I have, in spite of what I don’t. And I can choose to trust God with the rest of it.
